column1: Vila-seca (Catalan pronunciation: [ˈbilə ˈsɛkə]; literally 'Dry-town') is a municipality of the comarca of Tarragonès
column4: Spain. The historical name was Vila-seca de Solcina and since the 80's known as Vila-seca i Salou until Salou was segregated from Vila-seca on 1989
column5: however the municipality includes the urban areas of La Plana and La Pineda. Vila-seca has a large petrochemical complex shared with Tarragona and La Canonja
column6: including Repsol complex in El Morell makes one of the greatest petrochemical areas of Europe like Ludwigshafen am Rhein.

column1: In recent years the municipality has become popular with tourists
column2: as La Pineda has experienced a revitalisation to include an improved choice of hotels
column4: while including an array of attractions such as the aquopolis water park with dolphin and sea lion exhibitions and the nightlife hotspot

column1: The area is served by Reus Airport
column2: which operates many low cost and charter flights to destinations around Europe and North Africa. Barcelona Airport also serves the area.
